type AbstractStringBuilder = class inherit Object interface IAppendable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable interface ICharSequence interface seq<char> interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A mutable sequence of characters.

remarks.para: A mutable sequence of characters.
Implements a modifiable string. At any point in time it contains some particular sequence of characters, but the length and content of the sequence can be changed through certain method calls.
Unless otherwise noted, passing a null argument to a constructor or method in this class will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the current capacity.

remarks.para: Returns the current capacity. The capacity is the amount of storage available for newly inserted characters, beyond which an allocation will occur.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance char CharAt(int32 index) cil managed
abstract member CharAt : int -> char override this.CharAt : int -> char

Docs.param: the index of the desired char value.
Docs.summary: Returns the char value in this sequence at the specified index.
Docs.returns: the char value at the specified index.

remarks.para: Returns the char value in this sequence at the specified index. The first char value is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as in array indexing.
The index argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than the length of this sequence.
If the char value specified by the index is a surrogate, the surrogate value is returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

public virtual int CodePointAt (int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CodePointAt(int32 index) cil managed
abstract member CodePointAt : int -> int override this.CodePointAt : int -> int

Docs.param: the index to the char values
Docs.summary: Returns the character (Unicode code point) at the specified index.
Docs.returns: the code point value of the character at the index

remarks.para: Returns the character (Unicode code point) at the specified index. The index refers to char values (Unicode code units) and ranges from 0 to #length()- 1.

If the char value specified at the given index is in the high-surrogate range, the following index is less than the length of this sequence, and the char value at the following index is in the low-surrogate range, then the supplementary code point corresponding to this surrogate pair is returned. Otherwise, the char value at the given index is returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Function CodePointBefore (index As Integer) As Integer

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 CodePointBefore(int32 index) cil managed
abstract member CodePointBefore : int -> int override this.CodePointBefore : int -> int

Docs.param: the index following the code point that should be returned
Docs.summary: Returns the character (Unicode code point) before the specified index.
Docs.returns: the Unicode code point value before the given index.

remarks.para: Returns the character (Unicode code point) before the specified index. The index refers to char values (Unicode code units) and ranges from 1 to #length().

If the char value at (index - 1) is in the low-surrogate range, (index - 2) is not negative, and the char value at (index - 2) is in the high-surrogate range, then the supplementary code point value of the surrogate pair is returned. If the char value at index - 1 is an unpaired low-surrogate or a high-surrogate, the surrogate value is returned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the index to the first char of the text range.
the index after the last char of the text range.
Docs.summary: Returns the number of Unicode code points in the specified text range of this sequence.
Docs.returns: the number of Unicode code points in the specified text range

remarks.para: Returns the number of Unicode code points in the specified text range of this sequence. The text range begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the char at index endIndex - 1. Thus the length (in chars) of the text range is endIndex-beginIndex. Unpaired surrogates within this sequence count as one code point each.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub EnsureCapacity (minimumCapacity As Integer)
public: virtual void EnsureCapacity(int minimumCapacity);
public virtual void EnsureCapacity (int minimumCapacity);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EnsureCapacity(int32 minimumCapacity) cil managed
abstract member EnsureCapacity : int -> unit override this.EnsureCapacity : int -> unit

Docs.summary: Ensures that the capacity is at least equal to the specified minimum.

remarks.para:
Ensures that the capacity is at least equal to the specified minimum. If the current capacity is less than the argument, then a new internal array is allocated with greater capacity. The new capacity is the larger of:
  • The minimumCapacity argument.
  • Twice the old capacity, plus 2.
If the minimumCapacity argument is nonpositive, this method takes no action and simply returns. Note that subsequent operations on this object can reduce the actual capacity below that requested here.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the array to copy the data into.
Docs.summary: Characters are copied from this sequence into the destination character array dst.

remarks.para: Characters are copied from this sequence into the destination character array dst. The first character to be copied is at index srcBegin; the last character to be copied is at index srcEnd-1. The total number of characters to be copied is srcEnd-srcBegin. The characters are copied into the subarray of dst starting at index dstBegin and ending at index:

Docs.param: the index of the character to modify.
Docs.summary: The character at the specified index is set to ch.

remarks.para: The character at the specified index is set to ch. This sequence is altered to represent a new character sequence that is identical to the old character sequence, except that it contains the character ch at position index.
The index argument must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than the length of this sequence.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub SetLength (newLength As Integer)
public: virtual void SetLength(int newLength);
public virtual void SetLength (int newLength);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLength(int32 newLength) cil managed
abstract member SetLength : int -> unit override this.SetLength : int -> unit

Docs.summary: Sets the length of the character sequence.

remarks.para:
Sets the length of the character sequence. The sequence is changed to a new character sequence whose length is specified by the argument. For every nonnegative index k less than newLength, the character at index k in the new character sequence is the same as the character at index k in the old sequence if k is less than the length of the old character sequence; otherwise, it is the null character '\u005Cu0000'.
In other words, if the newLength argument is less than the current length, the length is changed to the specified length.
If the newLength argument is greater than or equal to the current length, sufficient null characters ('\u005Cu0000') are appended so that length becomes the newLength argument.
The newLength argument must be greater than or equal to 0.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns a string representing the data in this sequence.
Docs.returns: a string representation of this sequence of characters.

remarks.para: Returns a string representing the data in this sequence. A new String object is allocated and initialized to contain the character sequence currently represented by this object. This String is then returned. Subsequent changes to this sequence do not affect the contents of the String.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub TrimToSize ()
public: virtual void TrimToSize();
public virtual void TrimToSize ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TrimToSize() cil managed
abstract member TrimToSize : unit -> unit override this.TrimToSize : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Attempts to reduce storage used for the character sequence.

remarks.para: Attempts to reduce storage used for the character sequence. If the buffer is larger than necessary to hold its current sequence of characters, then it may be resized to become more space efficient. Calling this method may, but is not required to, affect the value returned by a subsequent call to the #capacity() method.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
